reviews.text:
We just had a play date at Avocuddle Playroom and had lots of fun! Our group had 3 babies, 2 of 11mo and 1 of 7mo so all in a spectrum of sitting, crawling and pulling up stages.

The whole floor is majorly padded with a soft mat and has a variety of toys all spread out, suitable from very young babies to older toddlers with pretend kitchen and shop areas and slides. I'd say it would fit comfortably at least 6-10 kids, parents included. Sandra the manager is very friendly and welcoming, offering us tea and coffees.

The sessions are 90-120mins long which is plenty of time to tire babies out, and there is space to park the prams. I hear the venue can also be hired privately, and sometimes include activities like messy play or sensory sessions. Would recommend.
Very nice place for any kind of family/ friend party. Sandra is amazing person and she helps a lot ! We had a wonderful time ❤️

We love visiting the playroom and recently had my son’s first birthday party there. He had an absolute blast and we as a family have so many great memories and photos from the day which will be so lovely to look back on in years to come. It felt a lot more special and fun than having the party at home. And Sandra is always amazing with the kids!

Would highly recommend having a party here or visiting the stay and play.

The AvoCuddle playroom is an amazing venue for a kid's birthday party. We had our son's second birthday party here and really recommend it. The space is lovely, clean, bright and with fun decorations, and tons of toys to play with for babies up to older kids. Sandra, the manager, was absolutely wonderful to deal with, responding to queries quickly, helping with all aspects of the organisation and an amazing support on the day for everything from taking photos, engaging with the kids, helping make people comfortable and filming everyone singing happy birthday. We ordered buffet food from the cafe and were really impressed with the quality, plus it's a lot easier than trying to sort it all out yourself! Can't recommend it highly enough for parties and looking forward to going back soon for stay and play.

This is my absolute favourite place to take my 2.5 year old and baby. There are tons of fun toys in a supervised, enclosed area. I can grab a coffee from the cafe upstairs, find a comfortable seat, and just watch my son play while feeding the baby. The toys are sanitized between every session and there is a good mix for all age groups. The owner, Sandra, is a rockstar. She’ll play with the kids, hold your sleeping baby, help put coats on, and even run upstairs to fetch your coffee if needed. Plus, she’s just good company if you’re desperate for adult conversation. I’ve also attended a few of the classes here and they are really quality. It’s a much nicer setting than the usual cold and echoing hall or church those classes are usually in. I’ve been coming here for 2 years and will definitely keep coming back.

address: The Star of Greenwich, 60 Old Woolwich Rd, London SE10 9NY, United Kingdom
